titles.title: Banking Regulator International Reporting Act
Banking Regulator International Reporting Act
To require Federal banking agencies to report on interactions with non-governmental international organizations, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.summary:
Banking Regulator International Reporting Act
This bill requires specified financial regulators to maintain records and annually report on interactions with certain nongovernmental international organizations. In particular, regulators must report any recommendations for international standardization regarding open-market policies and operations, discount lending and operations, or supervisory policies and operations.
